alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; Rock Springs and Green River; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; South Lincoln County; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Upper Green River Basin; Upper Green River Basin Foothills; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 3:44PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN PARK...FAR WESTERN FREMONT...SUBLETTE...SOUTHEAST LINCOLN AND NORTHWEST SWEETWATER COUNTIES... A snow squall accompanied by winds in excess 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. Multiple gusts above 40 mph have been observed in the past hour. At 342 PM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 9 miles east of Mariposa Lake to 9 miles southeast of Pinnacle Buttes to near Marbleton to 7 miles southeast of Elkol and moving east at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Kemmerer, Pinedale, Dubois, Big Piney, Farson, Granger, Marbleton, Diamondville, La Barge, Boulder, Daniel, Cora, Crowheart, Opal, Fontenelle, Big Sandy, Boulder Lake, Big Sandy Recreational Area, Squaretop Mountain and Warren Bridge. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
